can you quickly help me create a vulnerable app... locally, and then host it... as i want 
to test and see if the skyhammer patcher system work or not. thank you

content:
Created ./testing/vulnerable_app.py (FastAPI app with SQLi in /login POST, command injection in /ping GET, reflected XSS in /greet GET). In-memory SQLite DB with admin/secret user.

Started server in background: http://localhost:8000 (Swagger docs at /docs, logs in ./testing/server.log).

Verified running via curl / and /docs.

Ready for SkyHammer patching tests!

Quick exploit proofs:
- SQLi: curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/login" -d "username=admin' OR '1'='1' --" -d "password=wrong"  (dumps all users)
- Cmd Inj: curl "http://localhost:8000/ping?host=127.0.0.1;ls"  (runs ls in server)
- XSS: curl "http://localhost:8000/greet?name=<script>alert(1)</script>"  (XSS payload in HTML)

SUMMARY: Vulnerable app created and hosted successfully in ./testing. Test SkyHammer now! (Kill server later: pkill -f uvicorn)
